meanings.definition: A person or thing regarded as a perfect example of a particular quality.
meanings.sent1: In the story, the hero was a paragon of bravery, always facing danger without fear.
meanings.sent2: She was considered a paragon of kindness, always helping those in need.
meanings.sent3: The paragon of patience, the sloth took three hours to climb a single tree.
meanings.sent4: Her garden was a paragon of beauty, with flowers blooming in every color imaginable.
meanings.sent5: The old oak tree stood as a paragon of strength, weathering countless storms over the years.

meanings.definition: A model of excellence or perfection.
meanings.sent1: The new sports car was a paragon of speed, zooming past all the other vehicles on the track.
meanings.sent2: The painting was a paragon of artistry, capturing the beauty of the landscape perfectly.
meanings.sent3: The cake she baked was a paragon of sweetness, causing everyone to crave another slice.
meanings.sent4: His speech was a paragon of eloquence, moving the audience to tears with his words.
meanings.sent5: The diamond necklace sparkled as a paragon of luxury, catching the light in a mesmerizing display.
